title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points with 11 rebounds, leading the Celtics to a 124-105 win over the Bulls.
Payton Pritchard contributed 26 points, helping maintain the Celtics' dominance throughout the game.
Jordan Walsh impressed defensively with three steals and two blocks, adding 16 points to the Celtics' victory.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man in Boston, has been in ICE detention for five months for overstaying his visa.
Culleton, detained at East Montana ICE Detention Camp, describes poor conditions; DHS denies these claims, citing detention standards.
Culleton's lawyer argues for exemption from removal due to his U.S. citizen wife, despite missed green card interviews.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs played a significant role for the Patriots in their Super Bowl LX run, recording over 1,000 receiving yards.
Releasing Diggs could save the Patriots up to $20.8 million in cap space, as his $20.6 million salary isn't fully guaranteed.
Diggs, facing legal issues and turning 33, remains optimistic about staying, with support from both the Patriots and Drake Maye.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire departments rescued a dog named Rufus from the icy waters of Mill Pond Tuesday night.
Emergency crews responded promptly at 9 p.m. using a drone to locate the stranded dog for the rescue operation.
Rufus was safely retrieved within ten minutes and returned home without serious injuries, according to officials.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays and cancellations on all 12 commuter rail lines, impacting trains for over 12 hours on Wednesday.
More than 25 commuter rail trains were canceled, with some delayed up to 50 minutes, according to the MBTA.
Blue Line service was replaced by shuttle buses between Orient Heights and Wonderland due to a power issue.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj was found guilty of assaulting a police officer but acquitted of interfering with an officer.
Haxhiaj received six months probation and 40 hours of community service for the May 2025 incident.
The incident involved a confrontation during an ICE arrest, with video evidence shown in court.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue will open a new lounge, BlueHouse BOS, at Logan Airport's Terminal C near gate C23 this summer.
The Boston lounge will be 11,000 square feet, nearly 40% larger than the 8,000-square-foot JFK lounge.
The lounge features complimentary food, beverages, a full-service bar, private workspaces, and will reflect Boston's unique design.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN predicts Patriots will use their 2026 NFL Draft first-round pick on Utah offensive tackle Caleb Lomu.
Lomu, a 6-foot-6, 304-pound tackle, did not allow a sack in the 2025 season at Utah.
Despite Campbell's postseason struggles, coach Vrabel affirms he'll remain at left tackle for the Patriots.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, recently acquired by the Red Sox, models his game after former MVP Dustin Pedroia.
Durbin is expected to contribute as a strong defender and tenacious hitter, comparable to Pedroia's playing style.
In 2025, Durbin ranked third in NL Rookie of the Year voting, showing potential for increased power and low strikeouts.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advises Patriots quarterback Drake Maye to use Super Bowl loss as motivation to improve.
Brown shares personal experiences of overcoming championship losses to reach MVP status in 2024 NBA Finals.
Brown suggests Maye maintain a positive mindset and transform disappointment into fuel for future success.
